summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2013/05/02
Average Rating: 4.6
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Burning Oak Studios'], 'Studio': ['Burning Oak Studios']}
Review Text: Good traditional approach to a popular painting topic for watercolor painters.  Uses friskit to mask whites; lots of glazing; squirt bottle use for color spraying ala Tom Lynch; lifting; negative painting; pretty much the standard repertoire.  It was good for me since I have been away from painting for about 8 years and have forgotten so many tricks/techniques.  Video is technically clear with good sound track.  I actually rented it.
Review Title: Good display of techniques
Rating: 4.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2013/05/11
Average Rating: 3.9
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Burning Oak Studios']}
Review Text: Good review of basic watercolor techniques, especially how to paint a breaking wave.  This is usually a tough subject for a novice or intermediate painter even.  Tom uses a very nice palette but for newer painters there are probably too many colors.  Two great mistakes beginning painters make is to think that multiple pigments and fancy brushes make a painter.  Tom sticks to basic brushes but the palette limitation is really the only criticism I have.  I will rent/buy a few more of his DVDs.
Review Title: Good technique, well presented
Rating: 4.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Agatha Christie's Poirot, Series 12
Review Date: 2014/08/27
Store: David Suchet  (Actor),     Hugh Fraser  (Actor)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD
Product Description: ['As seen on PBS’s', 'Masterpiece Mystery!', 'Agatha Christie’s renowned Belgian detective solves the most challenging cases of the Art Deco era in these delightful adaptations starring David Suchet as “a near-perfect Poirot” (', 'USA Today', '). These four feature-length mysteries boast all-star casts including Jessica Chastain, Hugh Bonneville, Barbara Hershey, Toby Jones, Eileen Atkins, David Morrissey, Martin Shaw, Timothy West, and Zoë Wanamaker. THE MYSTERIES (original U.K. broadcast order) Three Act Tragedy—After guests at successive dinner parties mysteriously drop dead, Poirot teams up with an old friend to find the killer. Hallowe’en Party—Crime novelist Ariadne Oliver calls Poirot to investigate the macabre murder of a young girl at a children’s costume party. Murder on the Orient Express—Poirot searches for a killer among the travelers aboard a snowbound train. The Clocks—Poirot journeys to Dover to solve a case involving an unidentified corpse and four timepieces all stopped at the same time.']
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Television/British Television', 'Format': 'Color, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled', 'Contributor': 'Pauline Moran, David Suchet, Philip Jackson, Hugh Fraser', 'Language': 'English', 'Number Of Discs': '2', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.88 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'AMP2178', 'Media Format': 'Color, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled', 'Run time': '6 hours and 11 minutes', 'Release date': 'May 6, 2014', 'Actors': 'David Suchet, Hugh Fraser, Philip Jackson, Pauline Moran', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'ACORN MEDIA', 'Number of discs': '2'}
Review Text: He just gets better. Poirot is much more a human being in these final shows, his strengths and his weaknesses are ever-present. He exhibits humor, and rage, hard-nosed certainty and softly spiritual moments.  I cannot wait for Series 13 to be released in November. I have pre-ordered it.
Review Title: A Classic Series Winds Down with Surprises
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Midsomer Murders, Series 12
Review Date: 2015/04/20
Store: John Nettles  (Actor),     Jason Hughes  (Actor),     Richard Holthouse  (Director),     Peter Smith  (Director)    &                   1                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Mystery & Thrillers
Product Description: ["The English village mystery gets a contemporary spin in this hit British television series that has earned a worldwide following. Bucolic settings harbor macabre crimes and eccentric characters that are no match for nice-guy detective Tom Barnaby (John Nettles, BERGERAC) and his assistant, Detective Sergeant Ben Jones (Jason Hughes, THIS LIFE). Delightful in a murderously charming way (Leonard Maltin's Movie Crazy). Guest stars include Peter Davison, Philip Jackson, Jenny Agutter, Susannah Harker, Alice Krige, and Olivia Colman. THE MYSTERIES (original UK broadcast order) the Dogleg Murders - Members of a swanky golf club keep turning up dead by the 13th hole. The Black Book - a local art auction precipitates a string of savage murders. Secrets and Spies - a mysterious creature is killing sheep, but it soon moves on to larger prey. The Glitch - a scientist's determination to stop a business venture has fatal repercussions. Small Mercies - Little Worthing's tourism trade rests on it's model village - until a dead body disfigures it. The Creeper - a cat burglar's robberies expose a family's dark secrets. The Great and the Good - the possible closing of a village school leads to murder."]
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 9.92 Ounces', 'Item model number': '2320', 'Director': 'Richard Holthouse, Peter Smith, Renny Rye', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Box set, Color, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Run time': '10 hours and 50 minutes', 'Release date': 'September 23, 2014', 'Actors': 'John Nettles, Jason Hughes', 'Dubbed': 'English', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'Acorn', 'Number of discs': '4'}
Review Text: Probably the best TV of all time. Great acting, unbelievable settings, twisty plots and all that British accent!
Review Title: Super Stuff
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2016/04/27
Average Rating: 4.6
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Adrian Shergold', 'Peter Hoar', 'Farren Blackburn', 'Paul Whittington'], 'Producers': ['ITV'], 'Starring': ['Brenda Blethyn', 'Kenny Doughty', 'Jon Morrison'], 'Studio': ['BritBox']}
Review Text: You have to be alert with Vera. Lots of plots and subplots and everything you see is relevant to something. Plus she is often brief in her explanations, as if she's talking to herself rather than her sidekick. Our vote is 5 star for script, plot and acting, plus the sets are gorgeous along the coast of England.
Review Title: Pay attention! Listen to what Vera says.
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The analysis of the purchase history reveals a strong preference for instructional content related to watercolor painting techniques, indicating an engagement with the arts, specifically through practical learning and skill enhancement. Ratings are consistently high (averaging above 4.5), suggesting enjoyment and satisfaction, particularly with quality instructional videos that provide clear, comprehensive techniques.

The individual also demonstrates a keen interest in British television, particularly murder mysteries and character-driven narratives. Their selection of series exhibits a fondness for classic storytelling, intricate plots, and strong character development, as reflected in the high ratings given to both "Poirot" and "Midsomer Murders."

A tendency toward quality is evident, as the person frequently opts for products with high ratings while showing a moderate price sensitivity, indicated by preferences for renting over outright purchasing in some cases. They appreciate clear production values, technical clarity, and engaging content, whether in instructional videos or in their choice of television series.

Overall, the core preferences highlight a discerning, quality-focused shopper who enjoys both creative pursuits and captivating storytelling, particularly in the realm of English adaptations. This person favors timeless, well-crafted content that promises to enrich their artistic skills and entertain through complex narratives.

target_interaction.title: Sociopath at work. Watch at your own peril.
target_interaction.text: All morally defunct losers. David Vey(Michael Kitchen) is one of the most evil sociopaths in films. The movie is much darker than "noir" would suggest. Two stars because the acting is skillful
description: Michael Kitchen (Foyle's War) and Caroline Catz star in a tense British drama where lives intertwine and everyone is guilty of something.
target_interaction.subtitle: Season 1
